clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Stool Patterns to Collect a Panel of Stool Images for the Development of a Software
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study of Stool Patterns to Collect a Panel of Stool Images for the Development of a Software

lead_sponsor.agency: Danone Asia Pacific Holdings Pte, Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Danone Asia Pacific Holdings Pte, Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: To observe the stool patterns of healthy infants/toddlers by collecting a panel of stool images for the development of a software

detailed_description.textblock: To collect 200 images of per BITTS scale score to observe the stool pattern of healthy infants/toddlers aged 0-24 months to develop a software

primary_outcome.measure: Collection of at least 200 stool images per score of Brussels Infant and Toddler Stool Scale (BITSS) which consist of an assessment of stool consistency (scale 1 for hard lumps to scale 7 for watery stools).
primary_outcome.description: Creation of a database containing at least 200 pictures of soiled diapers per score (type 0 to 7) of the BITSS. There will only be one score per stool picture and there is no values represent a better or worse outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Validate the ability of parents/guardians to accurately determine the Brussels Infant and Toddler Stool Scale (BITSS) which consist of an assessment of stool consistency.
other_outcome.description: Validate the ability of parents/guardians to accurately determine (scale 1 for hard lumps to scale 7 for watery stools)
Questionnaire to assess parent/guardian usability of the e-diary

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy infants/toddlers (0-24 months of age)
- Born full-term (≥37 and ≤42 weeks gestation)
- Birth weight within normal range for gender and gestational age based on parentally reported medical history
- Infants/toddlers displaying symptoms of constipation or diarrhoea with a diagnosis of functional constipation or functional diarrhoea (precise descriptions to be established)
- Informed consent from parent(s) or legal guardian ≥18 years of age
- In-home access to reliable internet connections; a computer and/or mobile device suitable for electronic communication; a device suitable for capturing and transmitting high quality electronic images (e.g., cell phone camera)
Exclusion Criteria:
Infants/Toddlers:
- Known to have current or previous illnesses/conditions (excluding functional diarrhea and functional constipation) which could interfere with the study outcome, as per investigator's clinical judgment
- Participation currently or within the previous month in any other investigational/clinical study
Parents/Guardians of Infants/Toddlers:
- Known to have a significant condition (including during pregnancy) that might interfere with the study compliance, as per investigator's clinical judgment
- Deemed likely to be non-compliant with the study protocol, as per investigator's clinical judgment
